intro: Dolianthus archboldianus, commonly known as the Archbold's dianthus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with narrow, gray-green leaves. Dolianthus archboldianus is adapted to hot, dry environments and is often found in rocky soils.
